sentences: Network routing is the process of selecting a path across one or more networks.
These Internet routing decisions are made by specialized pieces of network hardware called routers.
In packet-switching networks, such as the Internet, routing selects the paths for Internet Protocol (IP) packets to travel from their origin to their destination.
A router is a networking device that connects computing devices and networks to other networks.
Path determination analyzes network metrics like delay, capacity, and speed to determine the optimal path for data movement.
Data forwarding is a process where a router forwards data to the next device on a selected path, ensuring it reaches its destination.
Routers use load balancing to send data packets using multiple paths, reducing errors, creating redundancy, and managing traffic volume.
A computer network is made of many machines, called nodes, and paths or links that connect those nodes.
Communication between two nodes in an interconnected network can take place through many different paths.
Routing is the process of selecting the best path using some predetermined rules.
Data Packets is the unit of data made into a single package that travels along a given network path.
IP address is a numeric value assigned to a network device.
Subnetting is a logical subdivision of an IP network.
Gateway address is the router interface connected to the local network that sends packets out of the local network.
A default gateway is a device that forwards data from one network to another.
A Default gateway let’s device from one network, communicate with devices on another network.
Default in default gateway means that the designated device is the first option that looked upon when data needs to exit the network.
